result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Javier Perez Jr

records.addlTxt: Applicant is not eligible for SPD Services

ADDRESS INFO for Javier Perez Jr
Current: 4708 19th Ave, Kenosha, WI 53140 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: 1562 35th Avenue, # 2B, Kenosha, WI 53144

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM. 
No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Yaharia T, Maria E. The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's YT's & ME's residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

2:22 PM
State appears by Attorney Alexandra Smathers. Defendant appeared in court in person. Clerk Dana A.  Minutes: The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel. Not guilty plea entered by court on behalf of DE. Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for January 6, 2023 at 09:00 am. $650 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). ec
and witness list filed by the State
